results.title: Clinical pharmacokinetics of atenolol--a review.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@impaired renal function@@@ elimination half life of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ gradually increases to values of 36 h in @DISEASE_Hemolytic_Uremic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D006463 @@@uraemic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (glomerular filtration rate (GFR) less than 10 ml/min).

citations.NLM: Kirch W, Görg KG. Clinical pharmacokinetics of atenolol--a review. Eur J Drug Metab Pharmacokinet. 1982;7(2):81-91. PMID: 6749509
citations.BibTeX: @article{6749509, title={Clinical pharmacokinetics of atenolol--a review.}, author={Kirch W and Görg KG}, journal={Eur J Drug Metab Pharmacokinet}, volume={7}, number={2}, pages={81-91}}

results.title: Single intravenous dose kinetics accumulation of atenolol in patients with impaired renal function and on hemodialysis.
results.text_hl: Single intravenous dose kinetics accumulation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@impaired renal function@@@ and on hemodialysis.

citations.NLM: Kirch W, Schäfer M, Braun M. Single intravenous dose kinetics accumulation of atenolol in patients with impaired renal function and on hemodialysis. Arch Toxicol Suppl. 1980;4():366-9. PMID: 6933939

results.title: Case report: atenolol overdose successfully treated with hemodialysis.
results.text_hl: Hemodialysis therapy is an effective treatment for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@, especially in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@impaired renal function@@@.

citations.NLM: Huang SH, Tirona RG, Ross C, Suri RS. Case report: atenolol overdose successfully treated with hemodialysis. Hemodial Int. 2013 Oct;17(4):652-5. PMID: 23347063
citations.BibTeX: @article{23347063, title={Case report: atenolol overdose successfully treated with hemodialysis.}, author={Huang SH and Tirona RG and Ross C and Suri RS}, journal={Hemodial Int}, volume={17}, number={4}, pages={652-5}}

results.title: Calcium channel blockers versus other antihypertensive therapies on progression of NIDDM associated nephropathy.
results.text_hl: Moreover, this enhanced slowing of @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal disease@@@ progression correlated with sustained and significant reductions in @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, findings not observed in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Bakris GL, Copley JB, Vicknair N, Sadler R, Leurgans S. Calcium channel blockers versus other antihypertensive therapies on progression of NIDDM associated nephropathy. Kidney Int. 1996 Nov;50(5):1641-50. PMID: 8914031

results.title: Inhibition of inflammation contributes to organ protection of atenolol in sinoaortic-denervated rats.
results.text_hl: Long-term treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ significantly prevented the @DISEASE_Organizing_Pneumonia @DISEASE_MESH:D000092124 @@@organ damage@@@ with a decrease in left ventricular weight, cardiac and aortic collagen contents, and @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@glomerular injury@@@ score in SAD @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang C, Xie HH, Lu ZA, Zhu MJ, Su DF. Inhibition of inflammation contributes to organ protection of atenolol in sinoaortic-denervated rats. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2004 May;43(5):663-8. PMID: 15071353

results.title: Effect of atenolol on serum beta 2-microglobulin level in hypertensive diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: The results suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ provides a favorable effect on renal function in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ uncomplicated by @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal dysfunction@@@.

citations.NLM: Koh H, Nambu S, Ikeda M. Effect of atenolol on serum beta 2-microglobulin level in hypertensive diabetic patients. J Clin Pharmacol. 1985 Apr;25(3):230-2. PMID: 3889077

results.title: Impaired elimination of atenolol in a nephropathic patient with self-medication overdose.
results.text_hl: A case of intoxication with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (plasma concentration of 2.71 mg/L) caused by an improper self-medication combined with @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@impaired renal function@@@ is presented.

citations.NLM: el-Yazigi A, Bouchama A, al-Abdely H, Yusuf A, Sieck JO. Impaired elimination of atenolol in a nephropathic patient with self-medication overdose. J Clin Pharmacol. 1993 May;33(5):450-2. PMID: 8331202

results.title: Long-term nebivolol administration reduces renal fibrosis and prevents endothelial dysfunction in rats with hypertension induced by renal mass reduction.
results.text_hl: One week after ablation, @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were distributed randomly according to the following experimental groups: control group containing @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@RMR@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ without treatment; @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@RMR@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ treated daily with @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ for 6 months (drinking water, 8 mg/kg per day); and @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@RMR@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ treated daily with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for 6 months (drinking water, 80 mg/kg per day).

citations.NLM: Pires MJ, Rodríguez-Peña AB, Arévalo M, Cenador B, Evangelista S, Esteller A, Sánchez-Rodríguez A, Colaço A, López-Novoa JM. Long-term nebivolol administration reduces renal fibrosis and prevents endothelial dysfunction in rats with hypertension induced by renal mass reduction. J Hypertens. 2007 Dec;25(12):2486-96. PMID: 17984671

results.title: Attenuation of hypertension-mediated glomerulosclerosis in conjunction with increased angiotensin (1-7).
results.text_hl: The @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@glomerular sclerosis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@GS@@@) index was lowered by @CHEMICAL_olmesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C437965 @@@olmesartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ compared with the vehicle group.

citations.NLM: Igase M, Yokoyama H, Ferrario CM. Attenuation of hypertension-mediated glomerulosclerosis in conjunction with increased angiotensin (1-7). Ther Adv Cardiovasc Dis. 2011 Dec;5(6):297-304. PMID: 22089474

results.title: Atenolol: a review of its pharmacological properties and therapeutic efficacy in angina pectoris and hypertension.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ is eliminated virtually entirely as unchanged drug in the urine and dosage needs to be reduced in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with moderate to severely @<m>DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@impaired renal function@@@ (glomerular filtration rate less than 30 ml/min).

citations.NLM: Heel RC, Brogden RN, Speight TM, Avery GS. Atenolol: a review of its pharmacological properties and therapeutic efficacy in angina pectoris and hypertension. Drugs. 1979 Jun;17(6):425-60. PMID: 38096
